   19: %%
   20: -module(dbg_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: %% Test functions
   23: -export([all/0, suite/0, init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   24:          groups/0, init_per_group/2, end_per_group/2]).
   25: -export([big/1, tiny/1, simple/1, message/1, distributed/1, port/1,
   26: 	 send/1, recv/1,
   27:          ip_port/1, file_port/1, file_port2/1, file_tracer/1,
   28:          ip_port_busy/1, wrap_port/1, wrap_port_time/1,
   29:          with_seq_trace/1, dead_suspend/1, local_trace/1,
   30:          saved_patterns/1, tracer_exit_on_stop/1,
   31:          erl_tracer/1, distributed_erl_tracer/1]).
   32: -export([tracee1/1, tracee2/1]).
   33: -export([dummy/0, exported/1]).
   34: -export([enabled/3, trace/5, load_nif/1]).
   35: 
   36: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   37: 
   38: suite() ->
   39:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   40:      {timetrap, {minutes, 1}}].
   41: 
   42: all() -> 
   43:     [{group, global}].
   44: 
   45: groups() ->
   46:     [{global,[],[{group, tests}]},
   47:      {tests,[],[
   48:                 big, tiny, simple, message, distributed, port, ip_port,
   49:                 send, recv,
   50:                 file_port, file_port2, file_tracer, ip_port_busy,
   51:                 wrap_port, wrap_port_time, with_seq_trace, dead_suspend,
   52:                 local_trace, saved_patterns, tracer_exit_on_stop,
   53:                 erl_tracer, distributed_erl_tracer]}].
   54: 
   55: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   56:     Config.
   57: 
   58: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   59:     dbg:stop(),
   60:     ok.
   61: 
   62: init_per_group(_, Config) ->
   63:     Config.
   64: 
   65: end_per_group(_, _Config) ->
   66:     ok.
   67: 
   68: %% Rudimentary interface test
   69: big(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   70:     {ok,OldCurDir} = file:get_cwd(),
   71:     Datadir=proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
   72:     Privdir=proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
   73:     ok=file:set_cwd(Privdir),
   74:     try
   75:         %% make sure dbg is stopped (and returns correctly)
   76:         ok = dbg:stop(),
   77: 
   78:         %% compile test module and make sure it is loaded.
   79:         {ok,Mod} = compile:file(Datadir++"/dbg_test",[trace]),
   80:         code:purge(dbg_test),
   81:         {module, Mod}=code:load_file(dbg_test),
   82: 
   83:         %% run/debug a named test function.
   84:         Pid = spawn_link(dbg_test, loop, [Config]),
   85:         true = register(dbg_test_loop, Pid),
   86:         {ok,_} = dbg:tracer(),
   87:         {ok,[{matched, _, 1}]} = dbg:p(dbg_test_loop, [m,p,c]),
   88:         ok = dbg:c(dbg_test, test, [Config]),
   89:         ok = dbg:i(),
   90:         dbg_test_loop ! {dbg_test, stop},
   91:         unregister(dbg_test_loop),
   92:         ok = dbg:stop(),
   93: 
   94:         %% run/debug a Pid.
   95:         Pid2=spawn_link(dbg_test,loop,[Config]),
   96:         {ok,_} = dbg:tracer(),
   97:         {ok,[{matched, _, 1}]} = dbg:p(Pid2,[s,r,p]),
   98:         ok = dbg:c(dbg_test, test, [Config]),
   99:         ok = dbg:i(),
  100:         Pid2 ! {dbg_test, stop},
  101: 
  102:         ok=file:set_cwd(OldCurDir)
  103:     after
  104:         dbg:stop()
  105:     end,
  106:     ok.
  107: 
  108: 
  109: %% Rudimentary interface test
  110: tiny(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  111:     {ok,OldCurDir} = file:get_cwd(),
  112:     Datadir=proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  113:     Privdir=proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  114:     ok=file:set_cwd(Privdir),
  115:     try
  116:         %% compile test module and make sure it is loaded.
  117:         {ok, Mod} = compile:file(Datadir++"/dbg_test",[trace]),
  118:         code:purge(dbg_test),
  119:         {module, Mod}=code:load_file(dbg_test),
  120: 
  121:         Pid=spawn_link(dbg_test,loop,[Config]),
  122:         if
  123:             is_pid(Pid) ->
  124:                 dbg:tracer(),
  125:                 {ok,[{matched, _node, 1}]} = dbg:p(Pid,[s,r,m,p,c]),
  126:                 ok = dbg:c(dbg_test,test,[Config]),
  127:                 ok = dbg:i(),
  128:                 Pid ! {dbg_test, stop};
  129:             true ->
  130:                 ok=file:set_cwd(OldCurDir),
  131:                 ct:fail("Could not spawn external test process.~n"),
  132:                 failure
  133:         end
  134:     after
  135:         dbg:stop(),
  136:         ok = file:set_cwd(OldCurDir)
  137:     end,
  138:     ok.
  139: 
  140: %% Simple interface test with own handler
  141: simple(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  142:     try
  143:         start(),
  144:         dbg:p(self(),call),
  145:         dbg:tp(dbg,ltp,[]),
  146:         dbg:ltp(),
  147:         stop(),
  148:         S = self(),
  149:         [{trace,S,call,{dbg,ltp,[]}}] = flush()
  150:     after
  151:         dbg:stop()
  152:     end,
  153:     ok.
  154: 
  155: %% Simple interface test with pam code that appends a message
  156: message(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  157:     {ok, _} = start(),
  158:     try
  159:         {ok, [{matched, _node, 1}]} = dbg:p(self(),call),
  160:         {ok, X} = dbg:tp(dbg,ltp,[{'_',[],[{message, {self}}]}]),
  161:         {value, {saved, Saved}} = lists:keysearch(saved, 1, X),
  162:         {ok, Y} = dbg:tp(dbg,ln,Saved),
  163:         {value, {saved, Saved}} = lists:keysearch(saved, 1, Y),
  164:         ok = dbg:ltp(),
  165:         ok = dbg:ln()
  166:     after
  167:         dbg:stop()
  168:     end,
  169:     S = self(),
  170:     [{trace,S,call,{dbg,ltp,[]},S},
  171:      {trace,S,call,{dbg,ln,[]},S}] = flush(),
  172:     ok.
  173: 
  174: send(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  175:     {ok, _} = start(),
  176:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  177:     rpc:call(Node, code, add_patha,
  178:              [filename:dirname(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config))]),
  179:     try
  180:         Echo = fun F() ->
  181:                        receive {From, M} ->
  182:                                From ! M,
  183:                                F()
  184:                        end
  185:                end,
  186: 	Rcvr = spawn_link(Echo),
  187:         RemoteRcvr = spawn(Node, Echo),
  188: 
  189: 	{ok, [{matched, _, 1}]} = dbg:p(Rcvr, send),
  190: 
  191:         send_test(Rcvr, make_ref(), true),
  192: 
  193:         %% Test that the test case process is the receiving process
  194:         send_test(Rcvr, [{[self(),'_'],[],[]}]),
  195: 
  196:         %% Test that self() is not the receiving process
  197:         {ok, [{matched, _, 1}, {saved, 2}]} =
  198:             dbg:tpe(send, [{['$1','_'],[{'==','$1',{self}}],[]}]),
  199:         send_test(Rcvr, make_ref(), false),
  200: 
  201:         %% Test that self() is the sending process
  202:         send_test(Rcvr, [{['_','_'],[{'==',Rcvr,{self}}],[]}]),
  203: 
  204:         %% Test attaching a message
  205:         send_test(Rcvr, [{['_','_'],[{'==',Rcvr,{self}}],[{message, hello}]}],
  206:                   make_ref(), hello),
  207: 
  208:         %% Test using a saved trace pattern
  209:         send_test(Rcvr, 2, make_ref(), false),
  210: 
  211:         %% Test clearing of trace pattern
  212:         {ok, [{matched, _, 1}]} = dbg:ctpe(send),
  213:         send_test(Rcvr, make_ref(), true),
  214: 
  215:         %% Test complex message inspection
  216:         Ref = make_ref(),
  217:         send_test(Rcvr,
  218:                   [{['_','$2'],[{'==',Ref,{element,1,{element,2,'$2'}}}],[]}],
  219:                   {test, {Ref}, <<0:(8*1024)>>}, true),
  220: 
  221:         send_test(Rcvr, {test, {make_ref()}, <<0:(8*1024)>>}, false),
  222: 
  223:         %% Test send to remote process
  224:         remote_send_test(Rcvr, RemoteRcvr, [], make_ref(), true),
  225: 
  226:         remote_send_test(Rcvr, RemoteRcvr,
  227:                          [{['$1','_'],[{'==',{node, '$1'},{node}}],[]}],
  228:                          make_ref(), false),
  229: 
  230:         remote_send_test(Rcvr, RemoteRcvr,
  231:                          [{['$1','_'],[{'==',{node, '$1'},Node}],[]}],
  232:                          make_ref(), true),
  233: 
  234:         %% Test that distributed dbg works
  235:         dbg:tracer(Node, process, {fun myhandler/2, self()}),
  236:         Rcvr2 = spawn_link(Echo),
  237:         RemoteRcvr2 = spawn(Node, Echo),
  238:         dbg:p(Rcvr2, [send]),
  239:         dbg:p(RemoteRcvr2, [send]),
  240:         dbg:tpe(send, [{['_', hej],[],[]}]),
  241: 
  242:         send_test(Rcvr2, make_ref(), false),
  243:         send_test(RemoteRcvr2, make_ref(), false),
  244:         send_test(Rcvr2, hej, true),
  245:         send_test(RemoteRcvr2, hej, true),
  246: 
  247:         ok
  248: 
  249:     after
  250: 	dbg:stop(),
  251:         peer:stop(Peer)
  252:     end.
  253: 
  254: send_test(Pid, Pattern, Msg, TraceEvent) ->
  255:     {ok, [{matched, _, _}, _]} = dbg:tpe(send, Pattern),
  256:     send_test(Pid, Msg, TraceEvent).
  257: send_test(Pid, Pattern) ->
  258:     send_test(Pid, Pattern, make_ref(), true).
  259: send_test(Pid, Msg, TraceEvent) ->
  260:     S = self(),
  261:     Pid ! {S, Msg},
  262:     receive Msg -> ok end,
  263:     send_test_rcv(Pid, Msg, S, TraceEvent).
  264: 
  265: remote_send_test(Pid, RPid, Pattern, Msg, TraceEvent) ->
  266:     dbg:tpe(send, Pattern),
  267:     TMsg = {self(), Msg},
  268:     Pid ! {RPid, TMsg},
  269:     receive Msg -> ok end,
  270:     send_test_rcv(Pid, TMsg, RPid, TraceEvent).
  271: 
  272: send_test_rcv(Pid, Msg, S, TraceEvent) ->
  273:     case flush() of
  274:         [] when not TraceEvent ->
  275:             ok;
  276:         [{trace, Pid, send, Msg, S}] when TraceEvent ->
  277:             ok;
  278:         [{trace, Pid, send, Msg, S, Message}] when TraceEvent == Message ->
  279:             ok;
  280:         Else ->
  281:             ct:fail({got_unexpected_message, Else})
  282:     end.
  283: 
  284: recv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  285:     {ok, _} = start(),
  286:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  287:     rpc:call(Node, code, add_patha,
  288:              [filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "..")]),
  289:     try
  290:         Echo = fun F() ->
  291:                        receive {From, M} ->
  292:                                From ! M,
  293:                                F()
  294:                        end
  295:                end,
  296: 	Rcvr = spawn_link(Echo),
  297:         RemoteRcvr = spawn(Node, Echo),
  298: 
  299: 	{ok, [{matched, _, 1}]} = dbg:p(Rcvr, 'receive'),
  300: 
  301:         recv_test(Rcvr, make_ref(), true),
  302: 
  303:         %% Test that the test case process is the sending process
  304:         recv_test(Rcvr, [{[node(), self(), '_'],[],[]}]),
  305: 
  306:         %% Test that self() is the not sending process
  307:         {ok, [{matched, _, 1}, {saved, 2}]} =
  308:             dbg:tpe('receive', [{[node(), '$1','_'],[{'==','$1',{self}}],[]}]),
  309:         recv_test(Rcvr, make_ref(), false),
  310: 
  311:         %% Test that self() is the receiving process
  312:         recv_test(Rcvr, [{'_',[{'==',Rcvr,{self}}],[]}]),
  313: 
  314:         %% Test attaching a message
  315:         recv_test(Rcvr, [{'_',[{'==',Rcvr,{self}}],[{message, hello}]}],
  316:                   make_ref(), hello),
  317: 
  318:         %% Test using a saved trace pattern
  319:         recv_test(Rcvr, 2, make_ref(), false),
  320: 
  321:         %% Test clearing of trace pattern
  322:         {ok, [{matched, _, 1}]} = dbg:ctpe('receive'),
  323:         recv_test(Rcvr, make_ref(), true),
  324: 
  325:         %% Test complex message inspection
  326:         Ref = make_ref(),
  327:         recv_test(Rcvr,
  328:                   [{[node(), '_','$2'],[{'==',Ref,{element,1,
  329:                                                    {element,2,
  330:                                                     {element,2,'$2'}}}}],[]}],
  331:                   {test, {Ref}, <<0:(8*1024)>>}, true),
  332: 
  333:         recv_test(Rcvr, {test, {make_ref()}, <<0:(8*1024)>>}, false),
  334: 
  335:         %% Test recv to remote process
  336:         remote_recv_test(RemoteRcvr, Rcvr, [], make_ref(), true),
  337: 
  338:         remote_recv_test(RemoteRcvr, Rcvr,
  339:                          [{['$1',undefined,'_'],[{'==','$1',{node}}],[]}],
  340:                          make_ref(), false),
  341: 
  342:         remote_recv_test(RemoteRcvr, Rcvr,
  343:                          [{['$1',undefined,'_'],[{'==','$1',Node}],[]}],
  344:                          make_ref(), true),
  345: 
  346:         %% Test that distributed dbg works
  347:         dbg:tracer(Node, process, {fun myhandler/2, self()}),
  348:         Rcvr2 = spawn_link(Echo),
  349:         RemoteRcvr2 = spawn(Node, Echo),
  350:         dbg:p(Rcvr2, ['receive']),
  351:         dbg:p(RemoteRcvr2, ['receive']),
  352:         dbg:tpe('receive', [{[node(), '_', '$1'],[{'==',{element,2,'$1'}, hej}],[]}]),
  353: 
  354:         recv_test(Rcvr2, make_ref(), false),
  355:         recv_test(RemoteRcvr2, make_ref(), false),
  356:         recv_test(Rcvr2, hej, true),
  357:         recv_test(RemoteRcvr2, hej, true),
  358: 
  359:         ok
  360: 
  361:     after
  362: 	dbg:stop(),
  363:         peer:stop(Peer)
  364:     end.
  365: 
  366: recv_test(Pid, Pattern, Msg, TraceEvent) ->
  367:     {ok, [{matched, _, _}, _]} = dbg:tpe('receive', Pattern),
  368:     recv_test(Pid, Msg, TraceEvent).
  369: recv_test(Pid, Pattern) ->
  370:     recv_test(Pid, Pattern, make_ref(), true).
  371: recv_test(Pid, Msg, TraceEvent) ->
  372:     S = self(),
  373:     Pid ! {S, Msg},
  374:     receive Msg -> ok end,
  375:     recv_test_rcv(Pid, {S, Msg}, TraceEvent).
  376: 
  377: remote_recv_test(RPid, Pid, Pattern, Msg, TraceEvent) ->
  378:     dbg:tpe('receive', Pattern),
  379:     TMsg = {self(), Msg},
  380:     RPid ! {Pid, TMsg},
  381:     receive Msg -> ok end,
  382:     recv_test_rcv(Pid, TMsg, TraceEvent).
  383: 
  384: recv_test_rcv(Pid, Msg, TraceEvent) ->
  385:     case flush() of
  386:         [] when not TraceEvent ->
  387:             ok;
  388:         [{trace, Pid, 'receive', Msg}] when TraceEvent ->
  389:             ok;
  390:         [{trace, Pid, 'receive', Msg, Message}] when TraceEvent == Message ->
  391:             ok;
  392:         Else ->
  393:             ct:fail({got_unexpected_message, Else})
  394:     end.
  395: 
  396: %% Simple test of distributed tracing
  397: distributed(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  398:     {ok, _} = start(),
  399:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  400:     try
  401:         RexPid = rpc:call(Node, erlang, whereis, [rex]),
  402:         RexPidList = pid_to_list(RexPid),
  403:         {ok, Node} = dbg:n(Node),
  404:         {ok, X} = dbg:p(all,call),
  405:         {value, {matched, Node, _}} = lists:keysearch(Node, 2, X),
  406:         {ok, Y} = dbg:p(RexPidList, s),
  407:         {value, {matched, Node, 1}} = lists:keysearch(Node, 2, Y),
  408:         {ok, Z} = dbg:tp(dbg,ltp,[]),
  409:         {value, {matched, Node, 1}} = lists:keysearch(Node, 2, Z),
  410:         dbg:cn(Node),
  411:         dbg:tp(dbg,ln,[]),
  412:         ok = rpc:block_call(Node, dbg, ltp, []),
  413:         ok = rpc:block_call(Node, dbg, ln, []),
  414:         ok = dbg:ln(),
  415:         S = self(),
  416:         {TraceSend, TraceCall} =
  417:         lists:partition(fun ({trace,RP,send,_,_}) when RP =:= RexPid -> true;
  418:                             (_) -> false end,
  419:                         flush()),
  420:         [_|_] = TraceSend,
  421:         [{trace,Pid,call,{dbg,ltp,[]}},
  422:          {trace,S,call,{dbg,ln,[]}}] = TraceCall,
  423:         Node = node(Pid),
  424:         %%
  425:         stop()
  426:     after
  427:         dbg:stop(),
  428:         peer:stop(Peer)
  429:     end,
  430:     ok.
  431: 
  432: 
  433: %% Tests tracing of local function calls.
  434: local_trace(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  435:     {ok, _} = start(),
  436:     try
  437:         S = self(),
  438:         %% Split "<X.Y.Z>" into {X, Y, Z}
  439:         "<"++L1 = L = pid_to_list(S),
  440:         NoDot = fun ($.) -> false; (_) -> true end,
  441:         {LX,"."++L2} = lists:splitwith(NoDot, L1),
  442:         {LY,"."++L3} = lists:splitwith(NoDot, L2),
  443:         ">"++L4 = lists:reverse(L3),
  444:         LZ = lists:reverse(L4),
  445:         X = 0 = list_to_integer(LX),
  446:         Y = list_to_integer(LY),
  447:         Z = list_to_integer(LZ),
  448:         XYZ = {X, Y, Z},
  449:         io:format("Self = ~w = ~w~n", [S,XYZ]),
  450:         {ok, [{matched, _, 1}]} = dbg:p(S,call),
  451:         {ok, [{matched, _, 1}]} = dbg:p(XYZ,call),
  452:         if Z =:= 0 ->
  453:                {ok, [{matched, _, 1}]} = dbg:p(Y,call);
  454:            true -> ok
  455:         end,
  456:         {ok, [{matched, _, 1}]} = dbg:p(L,call),
  457:         {ok, _} = dbg:tpl(?MODULE,not_exported,[]),
  458:         4 = not_exported(2),
  459:         [{trace,S,call,{?MODULE,not_exported,[2]}}] = flush(),
  460:         {ok, _} = dbg:tp(?MODULE,exported,[]),
  461:         4 = ?MODULE:exported(2),
  462:         [{trace,S,call,{?MODULE,exported,[2]}},
  463:          {trace,S,call,{?MODULE,not_exported,[2]}}] = flush(),
  464:         {ok, _} = dbg:ctpl(?MODULE),
  465:         4 = ?MODULE:exported(2),
  466:         [{trace,S,call,{?MODULE,exported,[2]}}] = flush(),
  467:         {ok, _} = dbg:tpl(?MODULE,not_exported,[]),
  468:         {ok, _} = dbg:ctp(?MODULE),
  469:         4 = ?MODULE:exported(2),
  470:         [] = flush(),
  471:         {ok, _} = dbg:tpl(?MODULE,not_exported,x),
  472:         catch ?MODULE:exported(x),
  473:         [{trace,S,call,{dbg_SUITE,not_exported,[x]}},
  474:          {trace,S,exception_from,
  475:           {dbg_SUITE,not_exported,1},
  476:           {error,badarith}}] = flush()
  477:     after
  478:         dbg:stop()
  479:     end,
  480:     ok.
  481: 
  482: %% Test that tracing on port works
  483: port(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  484:     try
  485:         S = self(),
  486:         start(),
  487:         TestFile = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),"port_test"),
  488:         Fun = dbg:trace_port(file, TestFile),
  489: 
  490:         %% Do a run to get rid of all extra port operations
  491:         port_close(Fun()),
  492: 
  493:         dbg:p(new_ports,ports),
  494:         Port = Fun(),
  495:         port_close(Port),
  496:         stop(),
  497: 
  498:         TraceFileDrv = list_to_atom(lists:flatten(["trace_file_drv n ",TestFile])),
  499:         [{trace,Port,open,S,TraceFileDrv},
  500:          {trace,Port,getting_linked,S},
  501:          {trace,Port,closed,normal}] = flush()
  502:     after
  503:         dbg:stop()
  504:     end,
  505:     ok.
  506: 
  507: %% Tests saving of match_spec's.
  508: saved_patterns(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  509:     dbg:stop(),
  510:     {ok,[{saved,1}]} =
  511:     dbg:tp(dbg,ctp,1,[{'_',[],[{message, blahonga}]}]),
  512:     {ok,[{saved,2}]} =
  513:     dbg:tp(dbg,ctp,1,[{['_'],[],[{message, blahonga}]}]),
  514:     Privdir=proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  515:     file:make_dir(Privdir),
  516:     File = filename:join([Privdir, "blahonga.ms"]),
  517:     dbg:wtp(File),
  518:     dbg:stop(),
  519:     dbg:ctp('_','_','_'),
  520:     {ok, _} = start(),
  521:     try
  522:         dbg:rtp(File),
  523:         {ok, [{matched, _, 1},{saved,1}]} = dbg:tp(dbg,ltp,0,1),
  524:         {ok, [{matched, _, 1}]} = dbg:p(self(),call),
  525:         dbg:ltp(),
  526:         S = self(),
  527:         [{trace,S,call,{dbg,ltp,[]},blahonga}] = flush()
  528:     after
  529:         dbg:stop()
  530:     end,
  531:     ok.
  532: 
  533: 
  534: 
  535: not_exported(N) ->
  536:     N * 2.
  537: 
  538: exported(N) ->
  539:     not_exported(N).
  540: 
  541: %% Test tracing to IP port
  542: ip_port(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  543:     stop(),
  544:     Port = dbg:trace_port(ip, 0),
  545:     {ok, _} = dbg:tracer(port, Port),
  546:     try
  547:         {ok, [{matched, _node, 1}]} = dbg:p(self(),call),
  548:         {ok, X} = dbg:tp(dbg, ltp,[{'_',[],[{message, {self}}]}]),
  549:         {value, {saved, _Saved}} = lists:keysearch(saved, 1, X),
  550:         {ok, Y} = dbg:tp(dbg, ln, [{'_',[],[{message, hej}]}]),
  551:         {value, {saved, _}} = lists:keysearch(saved, 1, Y),
  552:         ok = dbg:ltp(),
  553:         ok = dbg:ln(),
  554:         {ok, IpPort} = dbg:trace_port_control(get_listen_port),
  555:         io:format("IpPort = ~p~n", [IpPort]),
  556:         dbg:trace_client(ip, IpPort, {fun myhandler/2, self()}),
  557:         S = self(),
  558:         [{trace,S,call,{dbg,ltp,[]},S},
  559:          {trace,S,call,{dbg,ln,[]},hej}] = flush()
  560:     after
  561:         dbg:stop()
  562:     end,
  563:     ok.
  564: 
  565: 
  566: 
  567: %% Test that the dbg server does not hang if the tracer don't start (OTP-3592)
  568: ip_port_busy(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  569:     stop(),
  570:     Tracer = dbg:trace_port(ip, 4745),
  571:     Port = Tracer(),
  572:     {error, Reason} = dbg:tracer(port, Tracer),
  573:     try
  574:         io:format("Error reason = ~p~n", [Reason]),
  575:         true = port_close(Port)
  576:     after
  577:         dbg:stop()
  578:     end,
  579:     ok.
  580: 
  581: %% Test tracing to file port (simple)
  582: file_port(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  583:     stop(),
  584:     FName = make_temp_name(Config),
  585:     Port = dbg:trace_port(file, FName),
  586:     {ok, _} = dbg:tracer(port, Port),
  587:     try
  588:         {ok, [{matched, _node, 1}]} = dbg:p(self(),call),
  589:         {ok, X} = dbg:tp(dbg, ltp,[{'_',[],[{message, {self}}]}]),
  590:         {value, {saved, _Saved}} = lists:keysearch(saved, 1, X),
  591:         {ok, Y} = dbg:tp(dbg, ln, [{'_',[],[{message, hej}]}]),
  592:         {value, {saved, _}} = lists:keysearch(saved, 1, Y),
  593:         ok = dbg:ltp(),
  594:         ok = dbg:ln(),
  595:         stop(),
  596:         dbg:trace_client(file, FName, {fun myhandler/2, self()}),
  597:         S = self(),
  598:         [{trace,S,call,{dbg,ltp,[]},S},
  599:          {trace,S,call,{dbg,ln,[]},hej},
  600:          end_of_trace] = flush()
  601:     after
  602:         dbg:stop(),
  603:         file:delete(FName)
  604:     end,
  605:     ok.
  606: 
  607: %% Test tracing to file port with 'follow_file'
  608: file_port2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  609:     stop(),
  610:     FName = make_temp_name(Config),
  611:     %% Ok, lets try with flush and follow_file.
  612:     Port2 = dbg:trace_port(file, FName),
  613:     {ok, _} = dbg:tracer(port, Port2),
  614:     try
  615:         {ok, [{matched, _node, 1}]} = dbg:p(self(),call),
  616:         {ok, _} = dbg:tp(dbg, ltp,[{'_',[],[{message, {self}}]}]),
  617:         {ok, _} = dbg:tp(dbg, ln, [{'_',[],[{message, hej}]}]),
  618:         ok = dbg:ltp(),
  619:         ok = dbg:flush_trace_port(),
  620:         dbg:trace_client(follow_file, FName,
  621:                          {fun myhandler/2, self()}),
  622:         S = self(),
  623:         [{trace,S,call,{dbg,ltp,[]},S}] = flush(),
  624:         ok = dbg:ln(),
  625:         ok = dbg:flush_trace_port(),
  626:         receive after 1000 -> ok end, %% Polls every second...
  627:         [{trace,S,call,{dbg,ln,[]},hej}] = flush(),
  628:         stop(),
  629:         [] = flush()
  630:     after
  631:         dbg:stop(),
  632:         file:delete(FName)
  633:     end,
  634:     ok.
  635: 
  636: %% Test tracing to file
  637: file_tracer(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  638:     stop(),
  639:     FName = make_temp_name(Config),
  640:     %% Ok, lets try with flush and follow_file.
  641:     {ok, _} = dbg:tracer(file, FName),
  642:     try
  643:         {ok, [{matched, _node, 1}]} = dbg:p(self(),call),
  644:         {ok, _} = dbg:tp(dbg, ltp,[{'_',[],[{message, {self}}]}]),
  645:         {ok, _} = dbg:tp(dbg, ln, [{'_',[],[{message, hej}]}]),
  646:         ok = dbg:ltp(),
  647:         timer:sleep(100),
  648:         {ok, LTP} = file:read_file(FName),
  649:         <<"dbg:ltp()",_/binary>> = string:find(LTP, "dbg:ltp() ("++pid_to_list(self())++")"),
  650:         ok = dbg:ln(),
  651:         timer:sleep(100),
  652:         {ok, LN} = file:read_file(FName),
  653:         <<"dbg:ln()",_/binary>> = string:find(LN, "dbg:ln() (hej)"),
  654:         stop()
  655:     after
  656:         dbg:stop(),
  657:         file:delete(FName)
  658:     end,
  659:     ok.
  660: 
  661: %% Test tracing to wrapping file port
  662: wrap_port(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  663:     Self = self(),
  664:     stop(),
  665:     FName = make_temp_name(Config),
  666:     FNameWildcard = FName ++ "*" ++ ".trace",
  667:     %% WrapSize=0 and WrapCnt=11 will force the trace to wrap after
  668:     %% every trace message, and to contain only the last 10 entries
  669:     %% after trace stop since the last file will be empty waiting
  670:     %% for its first trace message.
  671:     WrapSize = 0,
  672:     WrapCnt = 11,
  673:     WrapFilesSpec = {FName, wrap, ".trace", WrapSize, WrapCnt},
  674:     wrap_port_init(WrapFilesSpec),
  675:     %% The number of iterations, N, is tested to place wrap the log,
  676:     %% giving a gap in the filename sequence at index 3.
  677:     %% This should be a difficult case for
  678:     %% the trace_client file sorting functionality.
  679:     N = 7,
  680:     lists:foreach(
  681:       fun(Cnt) ->
  682:               ?MODULE:tracee1(Cnt),
  683:               ?MODULE:tracee2(Cnt)
  684:       end,
  685:       lists:seq(1, N)),
  686:     stop(),
  687:     try
  688:         Files1 = filelib:wildcard(FNameWildcard),
  689:         io:format("~p~n", [Files1]),
  690:         Tc1 = dbg:trace_client(file, WrapFilesSpec,
  691:                                {fun myhandler/2, {wait_for_go,Self}}),
  692:         Tref1 = erlang:monitor(process, Tc1),
  693:         Tc1 ! {go,Self},
  694:         [{'DOWN',Tref1,_,_,normal},
  695:          end_of_trace
  696:          |Result] = lists:reverse(flush()),
  697:         M = N - (WrapCnt-1) div 2,
  698:         M = wrap_port_result(Result, Self, N),
  699:         %%
  700:         %% Start a new wrap log with the same name to verify that
  701:         %% all files are cleared at wrap log start. Only produce
  702:         %% two trace messages to also place the gap at index 3,
  703:         %% so the trace log will be misinterpreted.
  704:         %%
  705:         wrap_port_init(WrapFilesSpec),
  706:         Files2 = filelib:wildcard(FNameWildcard),
  707:         io:format("~p~n", [Files2]),
  708:         -1 = ?MODULE:tracee1(-1),
  709:         -1 = ?MODULE:tracee2(-1),
  710:         stop(),
  711:         Files = filelib:wildcard(FNameWildcard),
  712:         io:format("~p~n", [Files]),
  713:         Tc2 = dbg:trace_client(file, WrapFilesSpec,
  714:                                {fun myhandler/2, {wait_for_go,Self}}),
  715:         Tref2 = erlang:monitor(process, Tc2),
  716:         Tc2 ! {go,Self},
  717:         [{trace,Self,call,{?MODULE,tracee1,[-1]},Self},
  718:          {trace,Self,call,{?MODULE,tracee2,[-1]},hej},
  719:          end_of_trace,
  720:          {'DOWN',Tref2,_,_,normal}] = flush(),
  721:         %%
  722:         lists:map(fun(F) -> file:delete(F) end, Files)
  723:     after
  724:         dbg:stop()
  725:     end,
  726:     ok.
  727: 
  728: wrap_port_init(WrapFilesSpec) ->
  729:     Port = dbg:trace_port(file, WrapFilesSpec),
  730:     {ok, _} = dbg:tracer(port, Port),
  731:     {ok, [{matched, _node, 1}]} = dbg:p(self(),call),
  732:     {ok, X} = dbg:tp(?MODULE, tracee1,[{'_',[],[{message, {self}}]}]),
  733:     {value, {saved, _Saved}} = lists:keysearch(saved, 1, X),
  734:     {ok, Y} = dbg:tp(?MODULE, tracee2, [{'_',[],[{message, hej}]}]),
  735:     {value, {saved, _}} = lists:keysearch(saved, 1, Y),
  736:     ok.
  737: 
  738: tracee1(X) ->
  739:     X.
  740: 
  741: tracee2(X) ->
  742:     X.
  743: 
  744: wrap_port_result([], _S, M) ->
  745:     M;
  746: wrap_port_result([{trace, S, call, {?MODULE, tracee2, [M]}, hej},
  747:                   {trace, S, call, {?MODULE, tracee1, [M]}, S} | Tail],
  748:                  S,
  749:                  M) ->
  750:     wrap_port_result(Tail, S, M-1).
  751: 
  752: 
  753: %% Test tracing to time limited wrapping file port
  754: wrap_port_time(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  755:     stop(),
  756:     FName = make_temp_name(Config),
  757:     %% WrapTime=2 and WrapCnt=4 will force the trace to wrap after
  758:     %% every 2 seconds, and to contain between 3*2 and 4*2 seconds
  759:     %% of trace entries.
  760:     WrapFilesSpec = {FName, wrap, ".trace", {time, 2000}, 4},
  761:     Port = dbg:trace_port(file, WrapFilesSpec),
  762:     {ok, _} = dbg:tracer(port, Port),
  763:     try
  764:         {ok, [{matched, _node, 1}]} = dbg:p(self(),call),
  765:         {ok, X} = dbg:tp(?MODULE, tracee1,[{'_',[],[{message, {self}}]}]),
  766:         {value, {saved, _Saved1}} = lists:keysearch(saved, 1, X),
  767:         {ok, Y} = dbg:tp(?MODULE, tracee2, [{'_',[],[{message, hej}]}]),
  768:         {value, {saved, _Saved2}} = lists:keysearch(saved, 1, Y),
  769:         %% The delays in the iterations places two trace messages in each
  770:         %% trace file, but the last which is empty waiting for its first
  771:         %% trace message. The number of iterations is chosen so that
  772:         %% one trace file has been wasted, and therefore the first pair
  773:         %% of trace messages.
  774:         lists:foreach(
  775:           fun(Cnt) ->
  776:                   receive after 1000 -> ok end,
  777:                   ?MODULE:tracee1(Cnt),
  778:                   ?MODULE:tracee2(Cnt),
  779:                   receive after 1100 -> ok end
  780:           end,
  781:           lists:seq(1, 4)),
  782:         stop(),
  783:         Files = filelib:wildcard(FName ++ "*" ++ ".trace"),
  784:         io:format("~p~n", [Files]),
  785:         dbg:trace_client(file, WrapFilesSpec, {fun myhandler/2, self()}),
  786:         S = self(),
  787:         [{trace, S, call, {?MODULE, tracee1, [2]}, S},
  788:          {trace, S, call, {?MODULE, tracee2, [2]}, hej},
  789:          {trace, S, call, {?MODULE, tracee1, [3]}, S},
  790:          {trace, S, call, {?MODULE, tracee2, [3]}, hej},
  791:          {trace, S, call, {?MODULE, tracee1, [4]}, S},
  792:          {trace, S, call, {?MODULE, tracee2, [4]}, hej},
  793:          end_of_trace] = flush(),
  794:         lists:map(fun(F) -> file:delete(F) end, Files)
  795:     after
  796:         dbg:stop()
  797:     end,
  798:     ok.
  799: 
  800: %% Test ordinary tracing combined with seq_trace
  801: with_seq_trace(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  802:     try
  803:         {ok, Server} = start(),
  804:         {ok, Tracer} = dbg:get_tracer(),
  805:         {ok, X} = dbg:tp(dbg, get_tracer, [{[],[],
  806:                                             [{set_seq_token, send, true}]}]),
  807:         {value, {saved, _}} = lists:keysearch(saved, 1, X),
  808:         {ok, [{matched, _node, 1}]} = dbg:p(self(),call),
  809:         seq_trace:set_system_tracer(Tracer),
  810:         dbg:get_tracer(),
  811:         receive
  812:         after 1 ->
  813:                   ok
  814:         end,
  815:         S = self(),
  816:         ThisNode = node(),
  817:         [{trace,S,call,{dbg,get_tracer,[]}},
  818:          {seq_trace,0,{send,_,S,Server,{S,{get_tracer,ThisNode}}}},
  819:          {seq_trace,0,{send,_,Server,S,{dbg,{ok,Tracer}}}}] =
  820:         flush()
  821:     after
  822:         dbg:stop()
  823:     end,
  824:     ok.
  825: 
  826: 
  827: %% Test that trace messages concerning a now dead process does not crash dbg.
  828: dead_suspend(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  829:     start(),
  830:     try
  831:         survived = run_dead_suspend()
  832:     after
  833:         dbg:stop()
  834:     end.
  835: 
  836: run_dead_suspend() ->
  837:     dbg:p(new, call),
  838:     dbg:tp(?MODULE, dummy, []),
  839:     spawn(?MODULE, dummy, []),
  840:     spawn(?MODULE, dummy, []),
  841:     spawn(?MODULE, dummy, []),
  842:     spawn(?MODULE, dummy, []),
  843:     spawn(?MODULE, dummy, []),
  844:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
  845:     case whereis(dbg) of
  846:         undefined ->
  847:             died;
  848:         _ ->
  849:             survived
  850:     end.
  851: 
  852: dummy() ->
  853:     ok.
  854: 
  855: %% Test that a tracer process does not ignore an exit signal message when it has
  856: %% received (but not handled) trace messages
  857: tracer_exit_on_stop(_) ->
  858:     %% Tracer blocks waiting for fun to complete so that the trace message and
  859:     %% the exit signal message from the dbg process are in its message queue.
  860:     Fun = fun() ->
  861:                   ?MODULE:dummy(),
  862:                   Ref = erlang:trace_delivered(self()),
  863:                   receive {trace_delivered, _, Ref} -> stop() end
  864:           end,
  865:     {ok, _} = dbg:tracer(process, {fun spawn_once_handler/2, {self(), Fun}}),
  866:     {ok, Tracer} = dbg:get_tracer(),
  867:     MRef = monitor(process, Tracer),
  868:     {ok, _} = dbg:p(self(), [call]),
  869:     {ok, _} = dbg:p(new, [call]),
  870:     {ok, _} = dbg:tp(?MODULE, dummy, []),
  871:     ?MODULE:dummy(),
  872:     receive {'DOWN', MRef, _, _, normal} -> ok end,
  873:     [{trace,_,call,{?MODULE, dummy,[]}},
  874:      {trace,_,call,{?MODULE, dummy,[]}}] = flush(),
  875:     ok.
  876: 
  877: spawn_once_handler(Event, {Pid, done} = State) ->
  878:     Pid ! Event,
  879:     State;
  880: spawn_once_handler(Event, {Pid, Fun}) ->
  881:     {_, Ref} = spawn_monitor(Fun),
  882:     receive
  883:         {'DOWN', Ref, _, _, _} ->
  884:             Pid ! Event,
  885:             {Pid, done}
  886:     end.
  887: 
  888: %% Test that erl_tracer modules work correctly
  889: erl_tracer(Config) ->
  890:     stop(),
  891: 
  892:     ok = load_nif(Config),
  893: 
  894:     Self = self(),
  895:     {ok, _} = dbg:tracer(module, {?MODULE, Self}),
  896:     {ok, {?MODULE, Self}} = dbg:get_tracer(),
  897:     {ok, _} = dbg:p(self(), [c, timestamp]),
  898:     {ok, _} = dbg:tp(?MODULE, dummy, []),
  899:     ok = ?MODULE:dummy(),
  900:     [{Self, call, Self, Self, {?MODULE, dummy, []}, #{}}] = flush(),
  901:     ok.
  902: 
  903: %% Test that distributed erl_tracer modules work
  904: distributed_erl_tracer(Config) ->
  905:     stop(),
  906: 
  907:     S = self(),
  908: 
  909:     ok = load_nif(Config),
  910: 
  911:     LNode = node(),
  912:     {ok, Peer, RNode} = ?CT_PEER(),
  913:     true = rpc:call(RNode, code, add_patha, [filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "..")]),
  914:     ok = rpc:call(RNode, ?MODULE, load_nif, [Config]),
  915: 
  916:     NifProxy = fun() ->
  917:                        register(nif_proxy, self()),
  918:                        receive M -> S ! M end
  919:                end,
  920: 
  921:     LNifProxy = spawn_link(LNode, NifProxy),
  922:     RNifProxy = spawn_link(RNode, NifProxy),
  923: 
  924:     TracerFun = fun() -> {?MODULE, whereis(nif_proxy)} end,
  925: 
  926:     {ok, _} = dbg:tracer(LNode, module, TracerFun),
  927:     {ok, _} = dbg:tracer(RNode, module, TracerFun),
  928: 
  929:     {ok, [{matched, _, _}, {matched, _, _}]} = dbg:p(all,c),
  930:     {ok, [_, _]} = dbg:tp(?MODULE, dummy, []),
  931: 
  932:     {ok, {?MODULE, LNifProxy}} = dbg:get_tracer(LNode),
  933:     {ok, {?MODULE, RNifProxy}} = dbg:get_tracer(RNode),
  934: 
  935:     LCall = spawn_link(LNode, fun() -> ?MODULE:dummy() end),
  936:     [{LCall, call, LNifProxy, LCall, {?MODULE, dummy, []}, #{}}] = flush(),
  937: 
  938:     RCall = spawn_link(RNode, fun() -> ?MODULE:dummy() end),
  939:     [{RCall, call, RNifProxy, RCall, {?MODULE, dummy, []}, #{}}] = flush(),
  940: 
  941:     peer:stop(Peer),
  942:     ok.
  943: 
  944: load_nif(Config) ->
  945:     SoFile = atom_to_list(?MODULE),
  946:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  947:     case erlang:load_nif(filename:join(DataDir, SoFile) , 0) of
  948:         {error, {reload, _}} ->
  949:             ok;
  950:         ok ->
  951:             ok
  952:     end.
  953: 
  954: enabled(_, _, _) ->
  955:     erlang:nif_error(nif_not_loaded).
  956: 
  957: trace(_, _, _, _, _) ->
  958:     erlang:nif_error(nif_not_loaded).
  959: 
  960: %%
  961: %% Support functions
  962: %%
  963: 
  964: myhandler(Message, {wait_for_go,Pid}) ->
  965:     receive
  966:         {go,Pid} ->
  967:             myhandler(Message, Pid)
  968:     end;
  969: myhandler(Message, Relay) ->
  970:     Relay ! Message,
  971:     case Message of
  972:         end_of_trace ->
  973:             ok;
  974:         _ ->
  975:             Relay
  976:     end.
  977: 
  978: flush() ->
  979:     flush([]).
  980: flush(Acc) ->
  981:     receive
  982:         X ->
  983:             flush(Acc ++ [X])
  984:     after 1000 ->
  985:               Acc
  986:     end.
  987: 
  988: start() ->
  989:     stop(),
  990:     dbg:tracer(process, {fun myhandler/2, self()}).
  991: 
  992: stop() ->
  993:     dbg:stop().
  994: 
  995: make_temp_name(Config) ->
  996:     {A,B,C} = erlang:timestamp(),
  997:     FTMP = atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++ integer_to_list(A) ++ "-" ++
  998:     integer_to_list(B) ++ "-" ++ integer_to_list(C),
  999:     filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), FTMP).
